alert.note: Alert for Christian; Douglas; Greene; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 30 at 11:38AM CDT until March 30 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CHRISTIAN, NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS, SOUTHEASTERN GREENE, WEBSTER AND SOUTHWESTERN WRIGHT COUNTIES... At 1138 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southeastern Springfield, Nixa, Ozark, Marshfield, Strafford, Highlandville, Rogersville and Seymour. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 89 and 103. This includes the following low water crossings... Woods Fork at Woods Fork Road, Finley River at Johns Ford Road, Bull Creek at Center Road, Swan Creek at Swan Cave Road and James River at Bell Ford Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
